conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze forces on block A and cylinder B when angle changes from 37° to 30°.
When θ = 37°, block A is on the verge of sliding down the incline.
Static frictional force equals gravitational force component along the incline for θ = 37°.
Normal force perpendicular to incline is 0.8Mg.
Maximum static frictional force is μ_s * 0.8Mg.
At verge of sliding, μ_s * 0.8Mg = 0.6Mg, so μ_s = 0.75.
When θ = 30°, cylinder B is added between A and the incline.
Analyze forces on cylinder B: gravitational force is mg, normal force N' from block A, frictional force f' from block A.
Analyze forces on block A: gravitational force Mg, normal force N from incline, frictional force f from incline, normal force N' and frictional force f' from cylinder B.
Net force along incline for block A is zero: Mg sin 30° - f + f' cos α - N' sin α = 0.
Net force perpendicular to incline is zero: N + N' cos α + f' sin α - Mg cos 30° = 0.
Given M = 4m, substitute and simplify equations.
Frictional force f is determined by gravitational components and coefficient of friction.
After solving equations, friction force f = 0.45Mg.
The friction force of A on the slope is 0.45Mg.
